itemDescription: Tanzanian-Scottish rugby union footballer and coach

wikipedia_page.main: Nairn Alexander MacEwan (12 December 1941 – 31 May 2018) was a Scottish international rugby player and coach. He played at flanker, and was capped twenty times for Scotland between 1971–75, including a try in the match against England in 1972.

link_mentions.page: 1973 Argentina rugby union tour of Ireland and Scotland
response: North of Scotland: D.Aitchison; T.D.Dunlop, M.B.Paul, J.Adams, J.McGregory; D.Arneil e I.McRae; 1.Coull, David Leslie, Nairn McEwan; George Mackie, C.Snape; J.Braid, J.Hardie (S.Frazer), M.Clark.
